marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia foreign reserves increase to $155.7 billion at end of December 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of December 2024 rose to $155.7 billion, compared with $150.2 billion in November 2024. The reserve level is equivalent to financing 6.7 months of imports or 6.5 months of imports and external debt payments of the government, above the international adequacy standard of about three months of imports. The increase was driven by tax and service receipts, government foreign borrowing, and oil and gas foreign exchange earnings.

marketNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia discusses possible reduction of gas price subsidy recipients
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia said on Tuesday (7/1) that the ministry is discussing the possible reduction of the number of recipients of certain natural gas price subsidies (HGBT). He explained that the HGBT subsidies are intended to support economic growth and improve the competitiveness of national industry, and that companies that have recorded a good internal rate of return may be removed from the list of HGBT recipients. The statement came one month after the Acting Director General of Oil and Gas, Dadan Kusdiana, said that the Ministry of Industry had recommended adding 15 new sub-sectors as HGBT recipients. Previously, only seven industry sectors received the subsidy, namely ceramics, fertilizer, petrochemical, oleochemical, steel, glass, and rubber gloves.

marketNews.title: Minister of Industry Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita meets Apple VP and discusses investment proposal
marketNews.content: Minister of Industry Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita said on Tuesday (7/1) that he met with Apple Inc. Vice President of Global Policy Nick Ammann and mentioned that negotiations on a new Apple investment proposal are ongoing. He declined to give details of the proposal or the Indonesian government's requests, but emphasized that an investment value of $1 billion is insufficient. Previously, Minister of Investment and Downstream Rosan Roeslani claimed that Apple had committed to invest $1 billion in Indonesia in 2026. Apple needs Indonesian investment approval to obtain a new domestic component certificate (TKDN) so that the iPhone 16 can be sold in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Indonesia plans to raise up to $2 billion through dollar-denominated bond issuance
marketNews.content: Reuters reported on Wednesday (8/1) that the Indonesian government plans to raise up to $2 billion by issuing US-dollar-denominated bonds with maturities of five to ten years. The Ministry of Finance declined to comment on the matter.

marketNews.title: Malaysia announces temporary anti-dumping duties on PET imports from China and Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Malaysian government announced on Tuesday (7/1) the implementation of temporary anti-dumping duties on imports of polyethylene terephthalate (PET) plastic from China and Indonesia. The duties range from 6.33% to 37.44% and take effect on 7 January 2025.

marketNews.title: US labor market data shows job openings rise and services PMI increase
marketNews.content: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that job openings increased by 259,000 to about 8.1 million in November 2024, well above the consensus expectation of 7.7 million. In other data, the Institute for Supply Management reported that the US services Purchasing Managers' Index rose to 54.1 in December 2024, above the consensus of 53.3 and marking the tenth expansionary month in 2024. Following the release of both data sets, US equity indices fell on Tuesday (7/1) with the Dow Jones down 0.42%, the S&P 500 down 1.11%, and the Nasdaq down 1.89% amid concerns that a rebound in inflation could slow the pace of monetary easing by the Federal Reserve.

marketNews.title: East Ventures managing partner discusses potential IPO of Fore Coffee
marketNews.content: East Ventures Managing Partner Willson Cuaca told Investor Daily that the visit by Fore Coffee and East Ventures to the Indonesia Stock Exchange on Tuesday (7/1) was a casual discussion about market conditions. He did not rule out the possibility that an IPO of Fore Coffee could be one of the options being considered by the firm. Previously, Investor Daily reported that the Fore Coffee visit to the exchange sparked speculation about a potential IPO of the coffee start-up.

tickerNews.title: RATU listing on BEI and analysis of prospects
tickerNews.content: Raharja Energi Cepu (RATU) officially listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on Wednesday (8/1) at an IPO price of IDR 1,150 per share and closed up 25%, reaching the auto-reject upper limit (ARA) at IDR 1,435 per share. At the IPO, RATU was offered with a valuation of 13.1 times 1H24 annualized P/E, more premium than peers such as Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC) at 4.9 times 9M24 annualized P/E and Energi Mega Persada (ENRG) at 5.5 times 9M24 annualized P/E. The analysis provides guidance on how investors may view the stock's prospects beyond short-term trading opportunities. RATU is a holding company in oil and gas owned by Happy Hapsoro. Its subsidiary Rukun Raharja (RAJA) holds a 2.2423% participation in the Cepu Block through a 49% joint venture with PT Petrogas Jatim Utama Cendana (PJUC). RATU also holds an 8% participation in the Jabung Block through a 99% owned subsidiary PT Raharja Energi Tanjung Jabung (RETJ). Overall, RATU's performance grew in 1H24, with a production decline in Cepu offset by improved performance in Jabung. In 1H24, RATU recorded revenue of USD 28 million (+143% YoY) and net profit of USD 7.4 million (+20.3% YoY). Jabung contributed 58% of net profit and Cepu 42%. Jabung was acquired at the end of 2023 for USD 26.5 million for an 8% stake, implying an acquisition valuation of USD 1.3 million per MMBOE, much cheaper than recent comparable acquisitions: MEDC acquired 54% of Corridor Block in 2022 at USD 10.6 million per MMBOE, MEDC acquired 20% of Blocks 48 and 60 in Oman in 2023 at USD 11.4 million per MMBOE, and Hibiscus Petroleum acquired 38% of Block B Maharajalela in Brunei in 2024 at USD 12 million per MMBOE. RATU plans a new acquisition. On 16 October 2024, RAJA CEO Djauhar Maulidi announced that the company entered the final stage of talks to acquire a larger participation in a new oil and gas block, larger than its stake in Jabung. The acquisition is expected to be carried out by RATU, the upstream subsidiary of RAJA. RATU has a strong balance sheet with low net gearing of 0.15x post-IPO, providing solid capital. RATU forecasts that total oil and gas production from Jabung and Cepu in 2025 will be similar to the previous year, with production growth targeted for 2026, especially in Cepu through the Banyu Urip Infill Clastic program. Even without production growth, RATU expects double-digit revenue growth in 2025. The key takeaway is that while RATU has organic growth potential, its premium valuation relative to peers makes it less attractive on organic growth alone. The company is viewed as a growth stock, relying on inorganic growth through acquisitions of oil and gas blocks. The main factor for RATU is the success of expanding its oil and gas portfolio at reasonable acquisition valuations, whether by increasing participation in existing blocks or acquiring new ones. Successful acquisitions at attractive valuations would support a premium trading price, while failure to do so poses a major risk given the stock's premium valuation.

tickerNews.title: BUKA announces cessation of physical product sales on marketplace
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak announced that it will stop selling physical products on its marketplace as of 10 February 2025. Consumers will still be able to purchase virtual products such as mobile credit, data packages, and electricity tokens. In October 2024, Bukalapak had announced a restructuring and the shutdown of several business lines to achieve positive financial performance.

tickerNews.title: BBRI receives IDR 175 trillion KUR allocation for 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia obtained a KUR (People's Credit) allocation of IDR 175 trillion for 2025, representing 58% of the national KUR quota of IDR 300 trillion. The allocation consists of IDR 160 trillion for micro-scale KUR and IDR 15 trillion for small-scale KUR. The total KUR target for BBRI in 2025 is 6.1% higher YoY than the 2024 target of IDR 165 trillion, although it is 5.7% lower YoY than the revised 2024 target of IDR 185.5 trillion.

tickerNews.title: UNTR explores inorganic growth opportunities in mining and renewable energy
tickerNews.content: United Tractors' Corporate Secretary Sara K. Loebis said the company continues to monitor opportunities for inorganic development in the mineral mining segment and new and renewable energy (EBT). While not detailing specific future acquisitions, UNTR is open to expanding into commodities such as gold, nickel, copper, and iron ore, as well as EBT businesses like hydro-power, solar, geothermal, and waste-to-energy. UNTR allocated around USD 1 billion (~IDR 16.2 trillion) of capex for 2025, compared with USD 21 trillion in 2024, with 60% earmarked for mining contractor business, 20% for gold and nickel mining infrastructure, and 20% for other purposes.

tickerNews.title: Morgan Stanley sells and buys FILM shares, reducing stake
tickerNews.content: Morgan Stanley & Co. International plc, a shareholder of MD Entertainment, sold 62.9 million FILM shares at an average price of IDR 1,196 per share on 24 December 2024, totaling IDR 75.25 billion. On the same day, the firm bought back 29,300 FILM shares at IDR 3,645 per share, totaling IDR 106.82 million. After these transactions, Morgan Stanley's ownership in FILM fell from 14.0544% to 13.419%.

tickerNews.title: EXCL directors resign ahead of merger with Smartfren Telecom
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata announced that Rico Usthavia Frans and I Gede Darmayusa submitted their resignations as directors on 7 January 2025. Frans' resignation will become effective upon approval at the next shareholders' meeting, while Darmayusa's resignation will take effect when the merger between EXCL and Smartfren Telecom becomes effective. EXCL has not announced the date of the upcoming shareholders' meeting.

tickerNews.title: GEMS targets coal production and sales volumes for 2025 and plans capex
tickerNews.content: Golden Energy Mines' Corporate Secretary Sudin said the company targets coal production of 50-51 million tons in 2025, with sales of 51-52 million tons. These targets remain unchanged from 2024 because the new mining work plan and budget (RKAB) for 2024-2026 will apply for three years, unless revised. GEMS plans capex of USD 30-35 million in 2025 (versus USD 60 million in 2024) for hauling road facilities, port infrastructure, and other supporting facilities.

tickerNews.title: HOKI appoints Indomarco as new distributor for rice products
tickerNews.content: Buyung Poetra Hoki's Director Buyung Poetra Sembada, Budiman Susilo, said on Tuesday (7/1) that the company has appointed Indomarco as a new distributor for its products, including the Topi Koki rice brand and the Dailymeal healthy rice. Indomarco, part of the Salim Group, has about 600,000 active outlets in Indonesia. Distribution through Indomarco will cover modern trade, minimarkets, traditional stores, and other channels such as food service.

tickerNews.title: ADHI plans 2025 capex of 2-3 trillion rupiah and new water business
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya's Corporate Secretary Rozi Sparta said the company will allocate capex of around IDR 2-3 trillion for 2025 (versus about IDR 1.8 trillion in 2024). ADHI will add a new operating entity focused on clean water business. Previously, ADHI, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, has managed drinking water supply projects in Dumai, Karian-Serpong, and a seawater reverse osmosis system.

tickerNews.title: MINA announces tender offer for up to 2.8 billion shares
tickerNews.content: Sanurhasta Mitra's new controlling shareholder Hapsoro announced a mandatory tender offer for up to IDR 2.8 billion (43.05%) of MINA shares at IDR 25 per share from 9 January to 7 February 2025. The corporate action follows Hapsoro's acquisition of about 243.8 million MINA shares at an average price of IDR 23 per share on 20 November 2024, giving Hapsoro a direct ownership of 5.73% and an indirect ownership through PT Basis Utama Prima of 45.71%, becoming the new controlling shareholder.
